text:
We're hiring a *Content Marketing Specialist* at <https://www.globalme.net/|Globalme> / <https://summalinguae.com/|Summa Linguae Technologies>! It's a full-time remote role available in Canada :flag-ca:.

*<https://www.globalme.net/jobs/#job-576867|The job posting is available here>*. The role will be about 50% content writing (primarily blog posts and landing pages, but you'll be writing for all marketing channels) and 50% content strategy/management/editing. We're looking for someone with around 3 years experience with content.

I'm really excited about the role for a few reasons:
• We're basically creating a content program from scratch. Summa Linguae is an established company with over 300 employees worldwide, but grew primarily through M&A. They're investing seriously in marketing in North America for the first time, so it's a chance to make an impact and carve out your own role as our second full-time marketing employee.
• We translate all of our content into Swedish, Danish, Norwegian, and Polish, so it's an opportunity to learn about the content translation process (no previous experience required there)
• Our company does tons of cool language technology stuff like speech data collection for voice assistants and automated translation of e-commerce websites.
 The role reports into me (Global Marketing Manager), so feel free to DM if you have any questions.

text:
*<https://superside.com|Superside> is hiring a Content Marketing Manager to work alongside ME!* :partyparrot:

*<https://superside.vervoe.net/job-page/content-marketing-manager-full-time-remote-1/86d18798-0680-41ef-8e52-dbea4285e518|Learn more about the role here>.*

We're a design services company,  currently working with some of the biggest brands (Facebook, Shopify, Amazon, etc) to help them get design done at scale. Lots of major growth in the last year, and big things to come in 2021!

The role is 100% remote, so you can be based anywhere—no really, we have employees in over 48 countries.

We have a pretty flat org/team structure, so this position will be reporting into our VP of Marketing. We’re a small but mighty team of 3 right now, but are planning to hire a few more talented folks in 2021 as well.

*This role will be leading content strategy and production touching 3 key areas:*
1. Middle of funnel content for our blog and website
2. Sales enablement content
3. Customer marketing content
We haven’t spent much time creating content for these areas yet, so it’s a great opportunity to help round out our content strategy and really make an impact! Ideally you’ve got experience with things like case studies, customer newsletters, product tours/demos, and mid to bottom of funnel “convince style” blogs. Experience with video (like scripting and storyboarding) is a bonus.

If you’re interested and think you could be a good fit, shoot me a message with your LinkedIn/portfolio/resume. :wave:

attachments.title: Superside: Frictionless, delightful, tech-enabled design | Fast. High quality. Affordable.
attachments.text: Superside is an always-on design company that delivers hassle-free design at scale to enterprise teams. Trusted by 3,000+ businesses globally.
attachments.fallback: Superside: Frictionless, delightful, tech-enabled design | Fast. High quality. Affordable.

text:
Hi all -- not a content position, but my company Logikcull is hiring for a *Demand Gen Manager*. If you've got an awesome demand gen professional in your network and want to give them an exciting new job for the new year, send them this way!

We're looking for folks who are passionate about experimentation, obsessed with optimization, and looking to go harder, better, faster, stronger with a fast-growing legal tech startup and a, if I don't say so myself, pretty fun marketing team.

Listing is here: <https://jobs.lever.co/logikcull/14a5c73a-1c52-491e-a0fb-04c1eecc0927>

attachments.title: Logikcull - Demand Generation Manager
attachments.text: About Us Logikcull’s mission is to democratize the complex, expensive and risky process of legal discovery. By empowering organizations of all kinds with our powerfully simple, self-serve model and pay-as-you-go pricing, we’re disrupting an $80 billion dollar industry, helping ensure that people and businesses get a fair shake in our legal system, and making access to information fast and affordable for all. The Problem: Less than 2% of all legal disputes in the United States go to trial. Instead, the vast majority of litigation and investigations are resolved through the slow, insecure and ludicrously expensive process of discovery -- an institution so antiquated and clumsy, it’s still referred to as “eDiscovery.” Logikcull is the Spotify to eDiscovery’s clunky phonograph records; the Uber to its disjointed fleet of high-priced cabs. We empower people and organizations of all stripes to navigate the typically onerous, vendor-driven eDiscovery process with powerfully simple cloud-base
